ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained knowledge in playing and reading piano. I was especially challenged in reading multiple staffs at the same time, and with identifying chords etc. in figured bass and in jazz.
Figured bass music, some notation skills, understanding of lead sheets, understanding of piano reductions. Generally increased proficiency at the keyboard
I learned figured bass, melody harmonization, score reduction, and jazz harmony on piano
Basic music theory for piano, reading different clefs, figured bass, harmonization, leedsheet, orchestral and pop transcriptions, some jazz, etc.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think a strength was the small class size, since we all got to work so closely with each other. Even more collaborative projects and work would be great!
The course was very strong in terms of how it adapted to different students and how the weekly homework was structured to keep everyone accountable for practicing consistently .

This course covered a broad range of piano techniques. Its strengths were that the learning was very individualized and the pace was based on your ability. I think it could have benefited from a specific discussion of piano technique.

Loved the course! Especially great with the small class size. Fascinating material and lots and lots of room for personal creativity. Great, detailed feedback on every assignment and in class. Honestly the perfect course for any level of musician, since you really get what you put into it as the course and instructor have more than enough to offer.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely, yes. This course helped me developed a skillset that I will carry with me for the rest of my life. Reading music went from being something that intimidated me to something I love to do in my free time. Youre young, come on do it now! Take the class!
Yes! It's really great for improving applicable music theory, especially if you have basic beginner level skills in piano.
Yes, especially to those who are musicians but not keyboardists. Spending more time at the keyboard will improve every aspect of your musicianship no matter what you normally play. :)
Yes! Take this class if you want to get better at piano and improve your understanding of harmony, even if you are a beginner player

Yes! If you enjoy music whatsoever and have even touched a piano in your life you will have a blast. The class is somewhat of a build your own adventure, it can be chill or extremely advanced based on what youre looking for. Take it with Amy!
